name: Kepler-47
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-47 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-47 is a star with 0.96 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.94 times its radius. It is located 3442.02 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-47 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-47 system


Kepler-47 b

Kepler-47 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-47 b is 2.07018 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-47 b is 3.05 that of Earth. At 2.07018 Earth masses, Kepler-47 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


Kepler-47 c

Kepler-47 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.96 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-47 c is 3.17046 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-47 c is 4.65 that of Earth. At 3.17046 Earth masses, Kepler-47 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses. With a mass of 3.17046 Earth masses and a semi-major axis of 0.9638 astronomical units, Kepler-47 c could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.


Kepler-47 d

Kepler-47 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.70 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-47 d is 19.02912 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-47 d is 7.04 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-47 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-47, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
